result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L. Petroski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with advanced agent authorization.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

DNA sample. 

AODA and follow through with recommendations.  Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization. 

No going upon any premises where alcohol is served as primary good. 

No contact with anyone unlawfully using/possessing controlled substances.

AODA (unless already done). 

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department. 

Payment of unpaid court costs.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 8:37 am 
INCLUDES 16CF1090 AND 14CF681. 
State appears by ADA Chris Plaunt; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Yanke. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CF1090: Ct. 1>>3 yrs imprisonment - 1 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES. 
In 14CF681: Ct. 1>>3 yrs imprisonment - 1 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES>>AODA (unless already done); assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no going upon any premises where alcohol is served as primary good; no contact with anyone unlawfully using/possessing controlled substances; fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; payment of unpaid costs. 

COURT finds the deft eligible for CIP and SAP. 

COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONSECUTIVE to each other. 

COURT finds the deft entitled to: 
In 16CF1090>>182 days credit. 
In 14CF681>>231 days credit. 

Adj: 8:55 am

Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.
probation revocation packet

Review hearing on January 12, 2018 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:42 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF1090, 15CF490, AND 14CF681. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman. 
VRCW. 

PLEA HEARING IN 16CF1090. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Possess Illegally Obtained Prescription)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with advanced agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit. 

MOTION TO REVOKE DEOJ IN 14CF681. 
State moves to revoke DEOJ agreement on Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine). 
COURT grants and enters judgment of conviction on Ct. 1. 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: 30 days MCJ; AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with advanced agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 21 days jail credit. 

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 14CF681 AND 15CF490. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF681: Ct. 2>>90 days MCJ with 121 days jail credit. 
In 15CF490: Ct. 3>>9 months MCJ with 100 days jail credit. 
COURT ORDERS unpaid costs converted to civil judgment. 

COURT ORDERS ALL JAIL SENTENCES TO RUN CONCURRENT. 

Adj: 2:57 pm

to Revoke DEOJ on Count 1

Case Called: 10:36 am 
INCLUDES 14CF681, 14CF993, 15CF490, AND 15CF1060. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF681: Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>AMEND to DC pursuant to 947.01(1). 
In 14CF993: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF490: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF1060: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>DISMISS. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC)>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF681: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Amended Ct. 2 (DC)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF490: Ct. 3 (Obstructing an Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, defers entry of judgment on 1 felony count, and def guilty on 2 misd. counts. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF681: Ct. 1>>DEOJ for 2 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement. State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ, it will move to dismiss that charge. 
                    : Amended Ct. 2>>SWH for 1 year probation - CONDTIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
In 15CF490: Ct. 3>>SWH for 1 year probation - CONDTIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
Parties to submit written stipulation re: jail credit within 7 days. 
Review of DEOJ set for 1/12/2018 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA.
